												Imagine shooting up heroin whilst riding a roller-coaster made of crystalline excitement which is going through gargantuan hoops of fire over a swamp infested with three-headed sharks which have lasers for eyes and chainsaws for fins. That is exactly what Bus Simulator 2012 is not like.You are initially offered a choice between two settings, "Beginner" or "Expert". Beginner mode is essentially expert mode with more prompts and sunny weather. Even on the beginner setting there is a steep learning curve, I ended up watching tutorials online and consulting the manual due to the inadequacy of the limited in-game prompts and lack of help features.On the plus side the simulation is incredibly in-depth. Every single button on the bus is functional, including for example, all the switches for the blinds, windows, roof hatches, door locks and suite of climate controls. You also have the capability to fine-tune many aspects of the bus including brake and steering behavior, such as the brake speed and delay.The environment and its dynamic effects also add to the sense of realism. For example, if you have the heating on when it's raining outside the windows can fog up; this can be remedied by turning the air circulator to the defrost position. What's even more realistic is everyone whinges about the rain as they get on. On the downside, there are only 2 bus models (articulated and standard) to choose from which I found to be a bit of a let down. Perhaps a better game title would be "Very-specialised-urban-area-of-Germany-Two-Buses-Simulator 2012". The game-world is expansive and has a great level of detail. I really felt like a bus driver in Germany which was mildly depressing. The only thing which detracts from this sense of immersion is the handful of minor AI bugs, but they are rare. Occasionally when turning a tight corner a car will ram into you from behind which is annoying. On the other hand, it's quite amusing to see an overturned AI bus  - it makes you feel a bit better about your driving abilities. Overall graphics are average to decent but require abnormally high specs. It seems far too taxing but it's still playable on lower settings. The current price of $9.99 seems about right considering the simulation is very in-depth but the game feels unfinished in some areas.If you think you will find no enjoyment in driving a simulated bus for an hour then obviously don't buy it, otherwise give it a shot.Overall: 6.5/10

												After playing about 15 hours of Bus simulator 2012 I've had trouble coming to a conclusion about the quality of this game. Bus simulator 2012 is a very unique and indie bus game that is let's you simulate being a bus driver. This game is very in depth and so in depth it's very intimidating to start off. When I first bought Bus simulator 2012 I put about 20 minutes and couldn't figure out how to start my bus, so after that I threw it to the side and didn't come back to it for a few months. I really wanted to love this game, I like buses and I couldn't find a good bus sim but after a lot of troubleshooting I got my bus started and was able to play the game.       Here is the good parts of the game. It's very fun, I love the feeling of driving and trying to stay on time and try not to screw up. I also like the price, it's very cheap and if you really like buses then you could put many hours into this game. The Bus is fairly nice you can play it as an amature or play it as a bus efficantio. I like the amount of bus routes that are available to drive it gives a lot of replayability to the game. Overall it's very fun and it feels nice to drive.       Although the game is fun there are many problems with bus simulator 2012. One of the major issues is how extremely buggy it is. It's far from finished and it doesn't look like the developer is still updating the game which is a shame. Another of the games major problems is the city's design, the city isn't very well planed out. There are stop lights that don't make sense and there are stos with major congestion. I also dislike the mirror quality in the buses. The Mirrors on the bus are almost useless and the resolution of the mirror is also low. At high settings the mirrors work but they barely show anything, most of the time you just have to blindly change lanes and that can often be a problem. Another problem is the passengers animation. The passengers move extremely slow and you can not tell which pedestrians are trying to get on your bus and who isn't. It's also very hard to drive and make some turns, it took alot of pratice to get use to the buses size and how best to best maneuver the vehicle. I do wish their was an option to respawn your bus close to where you were, it became very frustrating to have to respawn the bus and start the route over because I got stuck in the fenses. Although the most frustrating part is the lack of a saving function. The saves don't work so you basicly have to start over your game once you quite. It doesn't affect the gameplay much but you have to write down your new driver id and password which is frustrating at most. Overall it's a good game but it has many major flaws.       Bus simulator 2012 is a very fun realist bus game with it's peaks and with it's flaws. It's really fun to play and the bus seems fairly heavy. I would like to see the developer put more effort into updating fixing bugs and polishing up their game. I feel It's not perfect but it can be really fun depending on how much time you are willing to put in. It's has major flaws but I would recommend this game to any person who likes buses and would like to drive one. 3/5

Do Not Buy! An Unoptimized MessI regret buying this game.  Bus-Simulator 2012 obviously intends to be a super-realistic bus simulator, down to having you remember a PIN to activate your bus' computer.  And that's totally fine, I enjoy hardcore sims and I was ready to tackle this one.But the problem is the graphics engine.  The stuttering lag-lag-lag takes any joy from playing this title.  My computer runs modern games fine.  Something similar to this title like Euro Truck Simulator 2 is buttery smooth.  But even on lowest graphics settings this title Bus-Simulator 2012 is a mess.  Needless to say, trying to drive a bus at less than 10fps is impossible.The physics engine seems to have problems too.  I saw a bus on the opposite side of the street suddenly flip over like it was weighless and settle on the corner of one of its bumpers, totally unrealistic. I hope my review saves someone the money and grief this title cost me!

												First and most importantly, this game is buggy and not well optimized. The frame rate drops randomly as you play, and there is no background loading going on, so when your view distance needs to update the frame rate just chugs. I have played around with the graphics settings and this is a issue even on medium. The tutorial is not well done, and I got stuck a few times, having to look for answers online. There is only 1 bus, and no real selection. The controls are poorly implemented and difficult to use, for example it is almost impossible to judge and make turns in some places. They make you use the arrow keys instead of wasd, why they did this is beyond me. The AI traffic isn't really that smart, and they will often block your path and get way too close boxing you in. So I turned the traffic density to the halfway mark, and all of a sudden there were like hardly any cars on the road. There is a bug where passengers just get stuck and block others from getting on, forcing a restart. Overall this is a poorly optimized, poorly implemented, buggy simulator. I would not recommend this for $10, this game is so bad it should be free.

												The idea of this game is good, but the execution is pretty poor. In particular, steering is absolutely atrocious, although I was only using a keyboard. But keyboard steering in the likes of Euro Truck Simulator 2 and OMSI 2 is pretty decent. In this game though, it's almost impossible. You're constantly either understeering or oversteering. The steering wheel seems to have a mind of its own. Acceleration and braking are also very laborious. It seems to take ages to do anything, like entering codes etc. (although that is quite cool - just a shame the execution is so poor) and the tutorials are not especially helpful.This is an old game, and pretty cheap. But even the low amount I paid was barely worth it. One thing I will say is that the graphics were very nice and the night lighting was superb. Better games than this can often have quite poor lighting at night, but this game has perfect night visibility - one of the few things it gets right.Essentially, the game looks great, and has a few nice touches. But while it delivers on great looks and realistic ideas, it fails to deliver on a smooth and enjoyable gameplaying experience. It's more frustrating than fun, so while it has a few good points, overall I cannot recommend this. As some other reviewers have said, you're much better off getting OMSI 2 for a decent bus simulator. Even SCS Software's old Bus Driver is a better game than this! That game doesn't have the same bells and whistles as BS 2012, but you can steer fairly well, pick up passengers and have a reasonably fun time. This game just drives you up the wall, which is really not where you want your bus to be going!

												Firstly, I'd like to start by saying that this is a game of average quality. I would still recommed it to someone looking for a bus simualator game, mostly due to it's cheap price. It has its pros and cons though, which I am going to metion here.Here are some of the pros:- You can freely drive your bus around the city.- The interior design of the bus is quite nice.- Lots of camera views, especially in the driver's seat.- All of the switches, buttons, and levers in the cab do something, (no dummy buttons).- Lots of routes to drive around the city.- You can walk around (free movement).- Controller support.However, the cons include:- Only one game mode.- They make you remember a password at the start of the first ever game that you then have to put in to make the cash register work every time at the start of each game!- Cash register very complicated to work and there is also no tutorial.- The bus announcements are in German only, despite it saying on the Steam Store page that the game includes 'Full Audio' in English.- If you crash into another vehicle, you have to wait 30 seconds before it becomes invisible and you can drive on.- It is impossible to drive around tight bends without hitting a vehicle on the inside.There are also faults with the game, for example:- Quite often someone rings the bell to get off, but when you open the back and front doors at the next bus stop, no-one gets off.- When driving towards a bus stop, you cannot tell if some of the pedestrians are walking to the bus stop to get on your bus, or are just going to walk straight past, because their heads only look forwards.- The cash register sometimes just stops working and you cannot press any keys.- It is not very realistic because the stop bell always gets rung at exactly the same number of seconds after driving past or leaving the previous bus stop. In real life, it could be rung at any time between stops.Overall, this is an average game. Although I'd recommend it, I would say go for Munich Bus Simulator (also available on Steam). It has none of the faults that I previously mentioned. It is more expensive but it is newer and so much better. You get what you pay for. This is a cheap game so I can't complain about value.
